SEARCH
Module graphicInterface
Package gameObjects

Class Player

java.lang.Object
gameObjects.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
Class that represents a player. A player has a name, a Position and a color. A player can move and place a barrier.
See Also:

    • move

      public boolean move(int x, int y, Board board, List<Player> playerList) throws Exception
      Moves the player to location (x ; y) if it is valid
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the to-be location
      y - y coordinate of the to-be location
      board - game board
      playerList - list of all players on the board
      Returns:
      Whether the player was moved or not
      Throws:
      UnknownDirectionException - if at some point, a direction is not valid
      BadPositionException - if x or y is lesser than 0
      Exception

    • placeBarrier

      public boolean placeBarrier(Edge e, Edge f, Board board, List<Player> playerList, List<Barrier> barrierList) throws BadWeightException
      Places a barrier on edges e and f if it is valid
      Parameters:
      e - first edge on which the barrier is placed
      f - second edge on which the barrier is placed
      board - game board
      playerList - list of all players on the board
      barrierList - list of all barriers on the board
      Returns:
      Whether the barrier was placed or not
      Throws:
      BadWeightException - if the weight is negative

    • isMoveValid

      public boolean isMoveValid(int x, int y, Board board, List<Player> playerList) throws Exception
      Checks if the move to (x ; y) is valid
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the destination
      y - y coordinate of the destination
      board - game board
      playerList - list of all players on the board
      Returns:
      if the move is valid
      Throws:
      UnknownDirectionException - if direction is not a valid direction
      BadPositionException - if x or y is lesser than 0
      Exception
